intro: Adenostephanus rufus, commonly known as the redsteppe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its habitat.
